text: A very small but quality exhibit offering a glimpse of the Chinese culture and its relation to Singapore early days. Very nice exhibits with story boards and artifacts. As it is small, I think you will be able to finish everything in it within 30 mins at max.
A small but meaningful gallery. There are some interactive exhibits such as the puppet show and the digital Chinese musical instruments. Attendance is free.
Great for the Gen Z to know about the cultural history. It is free.
Interesting to know about the Chinese culture.

A place to recall out our past diverse Intangile culture history heritage in Kreta Ayer (China Town).   These cultural art forms such as Chinese opera (Teochew, Hokk, Chinese puppet, nanyin music, tea appreciation and calligraphy.
